RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH: й Engenheiro Florestal e Mestre em Ciкncias pela Universidade de Sгo Paulo, com tese sobre Ecologia de Ecossistema Florestal usando a avifauna como bioindicador em ambientes da Mata Atlвntica. Fez Extensгo Universitбria na Universitа di Pisa, Itбlia, em projeto cientнfico com Biovalorizaзгo de Resнduos Orgвnicos coordenado pelo Institut National Polytechnique de Toulouse, Franзa (ALFA Program, European Commission). Recebeu o tнtulo de Philosophiae Doctor (PhD) em Agricultura e Ambiente, com кnfase em Ecofisiologia de Plantas Arbуreas pela Scuola Superiore di Studi Universitari e di Perfezionamento Sant'Anna di Pisa, Itбlia, em 2006, tнtulo reconhecido pela Universidade de Sгo Paulo como Doutor em Agronomia, бrea de Fitotecnia. Publicou 46 artigos em jornais e periуdicos especializados, 57 trabalhos em anais de eventos e um eBook. Possui 1 software e outros 662 itens de produзгo tйcnica, assessoria e consultoria. Participou de 32 eventos no exterior e 66 no Brasil. Recebeu 4 prкmios como pesquisador. Participou de 12 projetos de pesquisa em meio ambiente. Atua na бrea de Ecologia, com кnfase em Etnobiologia e Conservaзгo da Natureza, realizando pesquisas e executando trabalhos tйcnicos para licenciamento ambiental com caracterizaзгo da vegetaзгo e diagnуstico da fauna silvestre em Estudo de Componente Indнgena (ECI), Estudos de Impacto Ambiental (EIA), Relatуrio de Controle Ambiental (RCA), Avaliaзгo Ambiental Estratйgica (AAE) e Avaliaзгo Ambiental e Social (Environmental and Social Due Diligence). Em suas atividades profissionais interagiu com 56 colaboradores em coautorias de trabalhos cientнficos.
RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH-EN: graduation at Engenharia Florestal - Esalq from Universidade de Sгo Paulo (1992), master's at Forest Resources and Forest Engineering from Universidade de Sгo Paulo (1999) and doctorate at Ecofisiologia delle Piante Arboree from Scuola Superiore di Studi Universitari e di Perfezionamento Sant'Anna (2005). Has experience in Ecologia, focusing on Conservaзгo da Natureza, acting on the following subjects: ecossistema, conservaзгo, mata atlвntica, manejo and avifauna.

OUTRAS-INFORMACOES-RELEVANTES.OUTRAS-INFORMACOES-RELEVANTES:
Fabio Rossano Dario, born in Piracicaba, State of Sгo Paulo, Brazil, in 1964 December 10th, married. Forest Engineer and Magister Scientia by Universidade de Sгo Paulo, Brazil, I wrote a thesis on habitat management in the Atlantic Rainforest, using the avifauna as an ecological indicator. Doctor by Scuola Superiore Sant'Anna, Pisa, Italy, I wrote a thesis on physiology of arboreal plants. I developed and published several scientific researches in the area of genetic improvement, agroforestry systems, monitoring of ecosystems, evaluation of environmental impacts, organic agriculture and conservation and preservation of biodiversity, in Scrub Savanna, Atlantic and Amazon Rainforest, working with research institutes, enterprises, non governmental organizations and universities, gaining 15 years of experience as researcher and technician-scientific coordinator of several works in Brazil. I have good knowledge in Portuguese, Italian, Spanish, and English, and Statistical Analysis System. Lecturer of the University of Sгo Paulo, in the disciplines "Conservation of Nature" and "Management of Wild Fauna", from 1994 to 2000. Founding Member of Escola de Governo e Cidadania (School of Government and citizenship), executive and researcher manager of the Instituto de Pesquisas e Estudos da Vida Silvestre (Institute of Wild Life Research), technical coordinator of the Instituto de Pesquisas e Estudos Florestais (Institute of Forestry Research), consultant in environmental subjects by World Bank, Petrobras, Cia. Vale do Rio Doce, Amazon Vigilance System Project, Administraзгo das Hidrovias da Amazфnia Oriental (Administration of Hydroway in the Oriental Amazon), Biomйtrica (Biological Evaluations and Environmental Management), and participated as scientific researcher in the international program of cooperation ?Alpha Program? of Rйseau Atlantis, integrating into the project "Evaluation of effects of organic composts in sugar-cane crop?.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: O estudo foi realizado em бrea localizada na Serra do Mar, no domнnio da Mata Atlвntica, municнpio de Paraibuna, estado de Sгo Paulo, Brasil. Foram estudados trкs fragmentos de vegetaзгo natural e uma бrea de plantio de eucalipto adjacente. O fragmento de menor бrea constitui-se num corredor de vegetaзгo natural, interligando os dois fragmentos maiores. O principal objetivo foi analisar os grupos de aves afetados pela fragmentaзгo florestal e avaliar os impactos causados pela fragmentaзгo e o isolamento destas бreas e, utilizando a avifauna como indicador ecolуgico, analisar a efetividade do corredor na passagem de material genйtico entre os fragmentos. Os mйtodos utilizados para o registro da avifauna foram o de observaзхes por pontos fixos e captura e recaptura com auxilio de redes instaladas no sub-bosque dos fragmentos e do plantio de eucalipto.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Abstract: The diversity of birds is directly correlated with the structure of the forest. The fragmentation of forest, i.e., the disruption in the continuity of forest habitat cover can cause impacts on bird?s abundance, species richness, and community dynamics. Any interfering with the vegetation produces direct effects on the avifauna through the increase, decrease, or alternation of two key attributes: food and shelter. So, the composition of life in the forest is altered as changes occur in vegetation that directly interferes with the population structure of the avifauna, be those changes natural or anthropic. This study realized in forest fragments of Atlantic Forest in a metropolitan area of Sгo Paulo, Brazil, was to analyze the groups of birds that were affected by the forest fragmentation in different stages of ecological succession and the results show alterations in the diversity and density of bird?s species, principally among specialist species.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Diversity of frugivorous and omnivorous birds in different stages of ecological succession in Amazon Rainforest fragments

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-SUB-AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO: Estudo da Avifauna como Indicador Ecolуgico

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: ABSTRACT: The diversity of birds is directly correlated with the structure of the forest. Any interfering with the vegetation produces direct effects on the avifauna through the increase, decrease, or alternation of two key attributes: food and shelter. So, the composition of life in the forest is altered as changes occur in vegetation that directly interferes with the population structure of the avifauna, be those changes natural or anthropic. This study was realized in Amazon Rainforest fragments, and the main objective was to analyze the behavior of frugivorous and omnivorous birds in three different stages of ecological succession. In forest environments, where a vertical stratification of resources occurs, these species are distributed occupying a high diversity of trophic niches. The diversity and density of the frugivorous and omnivorous birds in the forest fragments in medium and advanced stage of ecological succession could be directly correlated not only with the structure of the forest but also to the fact that these birds feed almost exclusively on abundant and easy to find food source: shrub and tree fruit of certain vegetable species abundant in rainforest understory layer.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Traditional knowledge of the wild mammals and their ecological interactions by community indigenous Apiakб, Southern Brazilian Amazon Rainforest

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The objective of this study was accomplishes a knowledge survey of the Apiakб indigenous on the mammals of natural occurrence in their territory, who is located in the Mato Grosso State, Southern Brazilian Amazon Rainforest. As method for collect the data were used open and semi-structured interviews. Twelve indigenous were interviewed, with both genres and different ages. The interviewees mentioned 36 different species of mammals and they showed wide ecological knowledge regarding these animals. The oral transmission of knowledge occurs across generations.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: ESTUDO FITOSSOCIУLGICO DE UMA БREA DE CAATINGA EM ESTБGIO INICIAL DE SUCESSГO ECOLУGICA NO ESTADO DA PARAНBA, BRASIL
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Phytossociological study od Caatinga vegetation in initial stage of ecological succession in Paraнba State, Brazil

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Este estudo foi realizado em бrea inserida no ecossistema Savana-Estйpica Arborizada, do bioma Caatinga, localizada no municнpio de Campina Grande, estado da Paraнba. O objetivo deste estudo foi conhecer a composiзгo florнstica e a estrutura da vegetaзгo atravйs de estudo florнstico e inventбrio florestal em oito parcelas de 10 x 40 m, onde foram mensuradas todas as бrvores e arbustos com diвmetro ao nнvel do solo > 2 cm e altura > 100 cm. Foram calculados parвmetros fitossociolуgicos, нndices de Shannon (H?) e equitabilidade de Pielou (J). O estrato da vegetaзгo predominante й o arbustivo, com alturas variando entre 1 e 2 m, com presenзa de бrvores emergentes, cuja altura mбxima й de 5 m. A бrea basal total foi de 2,94 m2.ha-1. A fitossociologia registrou uma diversidade baixa de espйcies (n=20), com o valor de Shannon H?=1,89 nats.ind-1. As espйcies vegetais de maior densidade foram Mimosa tenuiflora, Croton blanchetianus, Poincianella pyramidalis, Croton heliotropiifolius, Jatropha mutabilis e Piptadenia stipulacea. As espйcies com maior valor de importвncia foram Mimosa tenuiflora, Ziziphus joazeiro, Croton blanchetianus, Poincianella pyramidalis e Commiphora leptophloeos. A florнstica registrou 65 espйcies, entre бrvores, arbustos, ervas, lianas e epнfitas. Com os resultados concluiu-se que a vegetaзгo encontra-se no estбgio inicial de sucessгo ecolуgica com diferentes graus de antropizaзгo.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: This study was carried out in an area inserted in the Savana-Estйpica ecosystem, part of the bioma Caatinga, and it is located near the town of Campina Grande, State of Paraнba, Brazil. The aim of this study was to describe the floristic composition and the structure of the vegetation through floristic studies and forest inventory. It was studied eight sampling plots of 10 x 40 meters, where were measured all trees and shrubs with stem diameter at soil level > 2 cm and height > 100 cm. It was calculated the phytosociological parameters, indexes of Shannon (H?) and Pielou equability (J). The predominant layer in the vegetation is the shrub, with heights ranging from one to two meters, and trees whose maximum height is of 5 meters. The total basal area was 2.94 m2.ha-1. The phytossociological study registered a low diversity of species (n=20). The Shannon?s index was H?=1.89 nats.ind-1. The species of highest value of importance were Mimosa tenuiflora, Ziziphus joazeiro, Croton blanchetianus, Poincianella pyramidalis, and Commiphora leptophloeos. The floristic study registered 65 species, among trees, shrubs, herbs, vines and epiphytes. Therefore, with the results it was concluded that the vegetation is in the initial stage of ecological succession with different degrees of human impact.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Uso de plantas da caatinga pelo povo indнgena Pankararu no Estado de Pernambuco, Brasil
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: The use of plants of the Brazilian caatinga biome by the indigenous Pankararu in Pernambuco State, Brazil

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Neste estudo de etnobotвnica realizado em territуrios indнgenas Pankararu, localizados no interior do estado de Pernambuco, Brasil, constatou-se, atravйs de entrevistas, a utilizaзгo de 87 espйcies vegetais e duas liquкnicas, sendo a maioria de ocorrкncia natural do bioma Caatinga e outras introduzidas para diversas finalidades, como medicinal, alimento, artesanato, lenha, utensнlios e construзхes em geral. O objetivo deste estudo foi realizar um levantamento do conhecimento que os Pankararu possuem sobre a vegetaзгo existente nos seus territуrios. O conhecimento das plantas e a relaзгo do homem com a natureza nгo sгo passados e nem aprendidos de maneira sistemбtica e formal entre estes indнgenas e sгo poucos os detentores destes conhecimentos. A grande variedade de espйcies vegetais registradas demonstrou que o uso das plantas й bem abrangente. Calculou-se o Нndice de Significado Cultural de cada planta. As espйcies de maior significado cultural sгo na maioria nativas, geralmente de uso medicinal para diferentes tratamentos, como Neoglaziovia variegata, Caesalpinia pyramidalis, Spondias tuberosa, Baccharis sylvestris, Commiphora leptophloeos, Syagrus coronata, Aspidosperma pyrifolium, Hyptis pectinata, Lippia macrophylla, Jatropha pohliana, Pithecellobium avaremotemo e Sideroxylon obtusifolium, demonstrando a importвncia das espйcies vegetais da Caatinga na sobrevivкncia cultural e ecolуgica dos Pankararu.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: In this ethnobotany study accomplished in the Pankararu indigenous territories, located in the State of Pernambuco, Brazil, through interviews was verified the use of 87 plant species and two lichen species, being most part of natural occurrence of the biome Caatinga and the others introduced for several purposes, such as medicine, food, handicrafts, firewood, utensils and buildings in general. The objective of this study was to accomplish a gathering of the knowledge that Pankararu possess about the vegetation of their territories. The knowledge of the plants and man's relationship with the nature neither are passed or learned in a systematic or formal way among these natives, there are few that holden theese knowledge. The great variety of registered plant species demonstrated that the use of the plants is comprehensive. The Cultural Significance Index of each plant was calculated. The species of most cultural significance are native, usually of medicinal use for different health treatments, as Neoglaziovia variegata, Caesalpinia pyramidalis, Spondias tuberosa, Baccharis sylvestris, Commiphora leptophloeos, Syagrus coronata, Aspidosperma pyrifolium, Hyptis pectinata, Lippia macrophylla, Jatropha pohliana, Pithecellobium avaremotemo e Sideroxylon obtusifolium, showing the importance of Caatinga species in the cultural and ecological survival of the Pankararu.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Diversity of birds and their ecological interactions in the Mura Indigenous Territory, Brazilian Amazon Rainforest

AUTORES.NOME-COMPLETO-DO-AUTOR: Natalia Livramento da Silva de Oliveira

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: The objective of this study was accomplishes a knowledge survey of the Mura indigenous on the birds of natural occurrence in their territory, who is located in the Amazonas State, Brazilian Amazon Rainforest. As method for collect the data were used open and semi-structured interviews. Twenty four indigenous were interviewed, with both genres and different ages. The interviewees mentioned 118 different species of birds, counting about 60% of the records, which in addition to the interviews was completed by surveying the bird by direct field observations with sighting and vocalization in different natural environments of the indigenous territory. The indigenous showed wide ecological knowledge regarding these birds. The oral transmission of knowledge occurs across generations.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: CONHECIMENTO TRADICIONAL DA AVIFAUNA PELOS INDНGENAS KAYABI, AMAZФNIA MERIDIONAL, BRASIL
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: CONHECIMENTO TRADICIONAL DA AVIFAUNA PELOS INDНGENAS KAYABI, AMAZФNIA MERIDIONAL, BRASIL

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Este estudo teve como objetivo um levantamento do conhecimento que os indнgenas Kayabi possuem sobre a avifauna de ocorrкncia natural na Terra Indнgena Kayabi, localizada na Amazфnia, entre os estados do Parб e Mato Grosso, Brasil. Para coleta de dados foram realizadas entrevistas com vinte e dois indнgenas que citaram 165 espйcies de aves e mostraram amplo conhecimento ecolуgico sobre estas aves, incluindo categorias relacionadas а morfologia, hбbitos alimentares, hбbitats e vocalizaзгo.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: The objective of this study was accomplishes a knowledge survey of the Kayabi indigenous on the birds of natural occurrence in their territory, who is located in Amazon Rainforest, between the states Parб and Mato Grosso, Brazil. As method for collect the data were used open and semi-structured interviews. Twenty two indigenous were interviewed. The interviewees mentioned 165 different species of birds and they showed wide ecological knowledge regarding these birds.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: The relationship between Bororo Indigenous and the wildlife in the Brazilian Savannah

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The objective of this study was accomplishes a knowledge survey of the Bororo indigenous on the mammals of natural occurrence in their territory, Meruri village, who is located in the Mato Grosso State, Brazil, in the Savannah biome, and also the relationship of the indigenous with these wild animals. As method for collect the data were used open and semi-structured interviews. Twenty-two indigenous were interviewed, both genres and different ages. The interviewees mentioned 37 species of mammals and they showed wide ecological knowledge regarding these animals. Such relationships are complex, being evidenced a mythical interaction between the man and the elements of nature. The oral transmission of knowledge occurs across generations.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Diversity and trophic structure of bird's communities in Brazilian Savanna areas of the Cuiabб River basin

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-SUB-AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO: Estudo da Avifauna como Indicador Ecolуgico

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-2.NOME-DA-SUB-AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO: Estudo da Fauna como Indicador Biolуgico

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
We analyzed the differences in composition, richness, and abundance of birds in different forest fragments of the Brazilian Savanna in the Cuiabб River basin, Mato Grosso State, Brazil, and we
demonstrated the variations in richness and abundance of birds between different trophic guilds. We
used point counts to characterize the avifauna. Sampling was conducted in two seasons: summer and
winter of 2018 in a total of 36 hours distributed in 108 samples. A total of 743 contacts were obtained
belonging to 87 bird species distributed among 17 orders and 33 families and categorized in 16 trophic
guilds. The omnivorous and insectivorous birds composed most of the community. For each species, we
calculated the abundance index value that showed our study site had a large number of species with low
index and few species with intermediate to high index compared to the pattern observed in other surveys. Our study area was characterized by high species diversity for both periods studied. The Shannon-Weaver diversity index for our study areas was 3.90 for the summer period and 3.77 for the winter period. Equitability was high, 0.82 for the summer period and 0.79 for the winter period, suggesting the number of species registered in our study site represented the maximum capacity the areas can shelter. Our results show that despite being a secondary and fragmented forest the study area was characterized by a diverse avian community. The ciliary forest studied that follows the Cuiabб River, although fragmented and isolated by extensive degraded areas and occupied by pastures and agricultural crops, they are important natural environments to maintain bird diversity.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: The relationship between Bororo Indigenous and the birds in the Brazilian Savannah

There were a total of five scientific expeditions to study the environmental impacts of a project in the region and more specifically the possible interferences in the life of the indigenous inhabitants of the region and those who live in harmony with the environment. The photos show the Xingu River, the riparian forest where the study was carried out and some of the bird species registered.
